content: Why? Becuase current Web Applications subscribe to a Web 2.0 application development pattern that is fatally flawed — a consequence of not taking the time to understand the underlying architecture of the Web (a/k/a AWWW). Rather than understand why TimBL (actual inventor of the Web) sought a semantically-enhanced dimension, it was broadly ridiculed as impractical babble — and in extreme cases tagged as a solution seeking a problem :( Net effect, you have Web applications that generally share the following flaws:  [1] Lack of verifiable identity — this subject matter isn’t even understood by most app developers as it gets tossed into the “philosophy” or “academic theory” buckets [2] Proliferation of broken Identity Tokens (i.e., what functions as Identity Cards for Identity Principals i.e., You and I ) [3] Authentication Protocols that are tightly-coupled with opaque Identity Tokens [4] Misuse of Transport Layer Security (TLS) that results in its underuse [5] Inability to distinguish an Application User from an Application.  Evidence of the cost these issues:  1. Fake News   2. Privacy Problems — a social and technological cocktail that can only be addressed via proper usage of the items above  3. Over reliance on Advertising business models — which is the achilles heel of mainstream media and social media platforms.
